titlestmt.titleproper: Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ records, 1928-2020.
titlestmt.author: Karen Clausen-Brown

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 2, 2024 at 15:34

did.unittitle: Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ records, 1928-2020.
did.abstract: The Council of Congregational Women of Connecticut was organized on October 2, 1928. The organization changed names numerous times over the course of its history but on May 13, 1997, became the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. From the time of the organization's founding in 1928, it divided itself into districts representing four geographical regions in Connecticut: the Eastern district, the Hartford district, the Litchfield district, and a fourth district called the New Haven district until 1973 when its name was changed to the Southwestern district. To communicate with and guide its members, the group has maintained an active program of writing and publishing a range of publications, and it has also planned a range of programs providing opportunities for its members to worship, study, and participate in service together. The organization's records document the changing roles of women in the church and society during the group's history. Records include meeting records, annual reports, governance and officers' records, records of sub-committees and districts, newsletters, guidebooks, correspondence, mailing lists, financial records, program and event records, histories and scrapbooks, and photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ records, 1928-2020, RG5477. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Nine cartons of materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Southern New England United Church of Christ Women's Connection in October, 2023; Accession 2023-50. An additional two cartons were donated by the Southern New England United Church of Christ in February, 2024, as part of an accrual to the General Association of Connecticut records; Accession 2024-11.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Karen Clausen-Brown in April, 2024, using DACS 2019.0.3.

bioghist.head: Historical
bioghist.p: The Council of Congregational Women of Connecticut was organized on October 2, 1928, in a meeting at Center Church in Hartford, Connecticut. On December 31, 1926, the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions and the Women's Board of Missions had merged. Congregational women across the country were reorganizing themselves as a result of this merger, and in Connecticut this reorganization took the form of the Council of Congregational Women of Connecticut. The Council itself represented a merger of four former organizations: the Women's Congregational Home Missionary Union of Connecticut, and three branches of the Women's Board of Missions in New Haven, Hartford, and Eastern Connecticut.

The women's organization has changed names numerous times over the course of its history. On April 22, 1936, the organization became the Council of Congregational-Christian Women of Connecticut. On April 23, 1947, it became the Fellowship of Congregational-Christian Women of Connecticut. The organization changed names again on April 19, 1950, becoming the Connecticut Fellowship of Congregational-Christian Women. When in 1964 the Connecticut State Conference changed its name to the Connecticut Conference of the United Church of Christ, the women's organization followed suit and revised its name once again, becoming on October 6, 1964, the Women's Fellowship of the Connecticut Conference of the United Church of Christ. On May 13, 1997, the organization adopted a name that would better reflect the combination of lay and clergy women in the organization: the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. Finally, on January 1, 2020, when the Connecticut Conference joined the Southern New England Conference United Church of Christ, the women's organization adopted the name that it uses today, Southern New England United Church of Christ Women's Connection.

From the time of the organization's founding in 1928, it divided itself into districts representing four geographical regions in Connecticut: the Eastern district, the Hartford district, the Litchfield district, and a fourth district called the New Haven district until 1973 when its name was changed to the Southwestern district. A set of elected officers have led the organization, and it has also executed its administrative and programming functions by means of a variety of sub-committees. To communicate with and guide its members, the group has maintained an active program of writing, editing, and publishing a range of publications: reading lists; various guidebooks for program planning, worship, study, service, and leadership; several newsletters; and booklets to facilitate and document annual meetings.

The group has held regular state-wide and district meetings for administrative and organizational purposes. It has also planned a range of programs providing opportunities for its members to worship, study, and participate in service together. These include leadership training conferences, quiet days, retreats, workshops, trips, and service programs. In the organization's early decades, it maintained a lending library for its members. In 1955, the organization supported efforts to assist churches in the Housatonic Valley flooded by Hurricane Diane. In 1987, it joined the United Church of Christ boycott of California table grapes.

The organization's records document the changing roles of women in the church and society and their efforts to recognize women as equal church members and leaders. The records of the Task Force on the Status of Women in Church and Society, the Advisory Commission on Women, the Committee on Women's Concerns, and the Coordinating Center for Women in Church and Society document the organization's efforts to redefine women's roles in the church in the wake of women's changing roles in society in the 1960s, 1970s, and early 1980s. The organization's Honored Laywomen Award, starting in the 1990s, recognized lay women leaders, and the Pioneer Women Clergy event of 2016 recognized early women clergy members. In 2012, the group drafted the Resolution on Women as Equal Partners in Church and Society, a document affirming their support of women as equals.
The organization continues today to provide opportunities for regional women to join together in worship, study, and service.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Connecticut Women of United Church of Christ, now called the Southern New England United Church of Christ Women's Connection. It includes administrative records, including meeting records, annual reports, governance and officers' records, and the records of sub-committees and districts; communications materials, including newsletters, guidebooks, correspondence, and mailing lists; financial records, including budgets, treasurers' reports, receipts, and invoices; records of programs, events, and initiatives; scrapbooks; and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into five series. The first series is further arranged into four sub-series, and the third series is further arranged into five sub-series. Records in each series and subseries have been primarily arranged chronologically by start date, and secondarily by topic.
Subseries 2: Executive and State Board meetings, 1928-2019

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: A cassette player is required to access material on cassette tape, and a CD player is required to access material on CD.

corpname.part: Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the administrative records of the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. Included are records of annual meetings and State Board and Executive Board meetings, records kept by the organization's presidents and other officers, organizational histories and scrapbooks, and records of the group's sub-committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records pertaining to the annual meetings of the organization, including minutes, annual reports, meeting programs and booklets, photographs, and an audio recording on cassette tape.

did.unittitle: Remarks from past presidents for the 75th annual meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records pertaining to the organization's Executive Board meetings and State Board meetings. Included are agendas, minutes, notebooks, and photographs.

did.unittitle: State Board and Executive Committee attendee's notebook
State Board and annual meeting notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records pertaining to the history, governance, and officers of the organization. Included are organizational histories and scrapbooks; officer lists and ballots; descriptions of officers' duties; records kept by presidents and secretaries; versions of the organization's constitution, by-laws, and manual; and records documenting policy votes and organizational planning and goals.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials removed from the front cover of this scrapbook can be found in Correspondence and clippings about August 1955 flood, 1955-1956, located in the Administrative series, Governance and officers' records sub-series.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and clippings about August 1955 flood

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Items in this folder were removed from the front cover of Scrapbook, 1953-1958, located in the Administrative series, Governance and officers' records subseries.

did.unittitle: Department of Lay Life and Work

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the organization's sub-committees, task forces, and commissions. Included are annual reports, planning and event records, and records kept by sub-committee leaders.

Task Force on the Status of Women in Church and Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the communications materials of the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. Included are organizational publications, reading lists, guidebooks, newsletters, presidents' letters and bulletins, correspondence, and address cards.

did.unittitle: Reading lists and Adventures in Reading
Recipes from Connecticut Women of the UCC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of the districts of the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. The districts represent the four geographical regions of Connecticut: the Eastern district, the Hartford district, the Litchfield district, and a fourth district called the New Haven district until 1973 when its name was changed to the Southwestern district. Included in the series are district officer lists and ballots, lists of event dates, mailing lists, program announcements, meeting programs, and scrapbooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Litchfield district, including district officer lists and ballots, mailing lists, lists of event dates, program announcements, meeting programs, annual reports, notebooks, and scrapbooks. Records pertaining jointly to the Southwestern and Litchfield districts are located in the Southwestern district subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Hartford district, including district officer lists and ballots, mailing lists, lists of event dates, program announcements, meeting programs, annual reports, financial records, officer notebooks, and a scrapbook.

did.unittitle: Archival Notebook #2B, held by Recording Secretary
Archival Notebook #2B, held by Recording Secretary
Archival Notebook, Volume #1, held by President
Archival Notebook, Volume #1, held by President
Archival Notebook, Volume #1, held by President
Archival Notebook, Volume #1, held by President
Archival Notebook #2B, held by Recording Secretary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Eastern district, including district officer lists and ballots, mailing lists, lists of event dates, program announcements, meeting programs, and an annual report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the New Haven district, including district officer lists and ballots, mailing lists, lists of event dates, program announcements, meeting programs, annual reports, scrapbooks, and photographs. The New Haven district became the Southwestern district in 1973, and records of the Southwestern district can be found in the Southwestern district subseries.

did.unittitle: Materials removed from New Haven district scrapbook

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Items in this folder were removed from New Haven district scrapbook, 1968-1975, located in the District records series, New Haven district records subseries.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials removed from this scrapbook can be found in Materials removed from New Haven district scrapbook, 1964-1975 and Photographs removed from New Haven district scrapbook, 1971, undated. Both folders are located in the District records series, New Haven district records subseries.

did.unittitle: Photographs removed from New Haven district scrapbook

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Items in this folder were removed from New Haven district scrapbook, 1968-1975, located in the District records series, New Haven district subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Southwestern district, including district officer lists and ballots, mailing lists, lists of event dates, program announcements, meeting programs, annual reports, and officer notebooks. This subseries also contains records pertaining jointly to the Southwestern and Litchfield districts. Until 1973, the Southwestern district was known as the New Haven district, and records of the New Haven district can be found in the New Haven district subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the financial records of the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. Included are treasurers' reports, budgets, charitable fund and gift records, records of fundraising and donations, trust fund records, check registers, bank statements, invoices and receipts, financial correspondence, and a ledger.

did.unittitle: Hartford National Bank and Trust Company statements
Church Women United in Connecticut contributions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of the programs, events, initiatives, and resolutions of the Connecticut Women of the United Church of Christ. Included are records of conferences, retreats, orientations, trips, services, ceremonies, and other special events; records of service projects and charitable causes; resolution statements in support of special causes; records of efforts to honor lay and clergy women; scripts for plays and pageants; texts of readings, prayers, and liturgies; and event photographs and slides.
